page.title: 02Transport.
page.content:
Running diagonally from North to East is the A646 Trunk road carrying traffic from much of North East Lancashire to Todmorden and West Yorkshire. Many vehicles also use this road to by-pass Burnley town centre.
Running from North to South is the A56 Trunk road running from Skipton and North Yorkshire, through the centre of Burnley and intersecting with the A646 in the top right hand quarter of our area. It then proceeds to run southwards across the moors to Rawtenstall and eventually Manchester. Until early in 1985 this was an extremely busy road, but a lot of traffic has now been diverted to the newly opened motorway M65.
